This incident occurred at the DHL LEJ Hub, Hermann-Koehl-Strasse 1 SCHKEUDITZ,Leipzig, 04435 Germany. Transportation by air has been confirmed.

item.title: Report E-2023030112
item.description:
Report E-2023030112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-02
  • City: portland
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Drum of material was placed onto liftgate which was then raised in order to transfer drum to the truck. The employee lost control of the drum, which fell off the truck onto the pavement. The drum landed on the top rim, denting the drum and partially dislodging the lid and releasing approximately 10-15 gallons of material. The release was quickly contained, absorbed and placed into a suitable salvage drum along with damaged container and it's remaining contents. The material was then shipped to the original destination facility without further incident. The incident was resolved within a short time, less than an hour.

item.title: Report X-2022120837
item.description:
Report X-2022120837

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-09
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered during the unloading process. The package was placed in a red hazmat tote and brought to the QA dept for further processing. DescribePack: The package appeared stained on the outside of the box. Upon inspection there were 2 2.5 gallon jug containers of hypochlorite solution that were appearing wet and the inner liner of the package was stained. There was no additional packaging material. Upon inspection of both jugs, one the containers presented with a slight decrease in liquid content. There were no punctures but it could be assumed the cap is not sealed . DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was processed immediately and contained in an appropriate hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2022101122
item.description:
Report X-2022101122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-13
  • City: SOUTH PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: OPENED FIVE PACKAGES ALL FROM THE SAME LOCATION GOING TO THE SAME DESTINATION FOR VERIFICATION OF THE CONTENTS DUE TO SUSPICION OF POSSIBLY CONTAINING LAPTOPS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH BOX CONTAINED ONE LAPTOP OR ONE TABLET. PACKAGES DO NOT MEET IATA ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION II PI 967 DUE TO CONSIGNMENT HAS MORE THAN TWO PACKAGES OFFERED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z4E9W580136268712, 1Z4E9W580113490176, 1Z4E9W580105708652 AND 1Z4E9W580133619375. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4E9W58, NFRASTRUCTURE AASP, 190 RIVERSIDE ST 11A, PORTLAND ME 04103.

item.title: Report E-2022100445
item.description:
Report E-2022100445

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-11
  • City: SIDNEY
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XAG contacted ERTS to report a one-gallon spill of regulated UN1866 "ArmorFlexÂ® 99F" that was released from one 55-gallon metal drum as a result of a forklift puncture that was discovered during delivery to the customer. The caller stated that the spill was ongoing and that the terminal did not have a recovery drum to place this in. ERTS dispatched Clean Harbors to conduct cleanup. At 0700 ET, CH advised there was a minimal release which was contained to the cardboard that XPO taped to the drum. Contractors removed the cardboard, duct taped the hole & then overpacked the drum into an 85 gallon poly drum. No absorbent was needed for cleanup and the waste drum was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022100139
item.description:
Report E-2022100139

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-30
  • City: Waterville
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 09/30/22 at 12:58 hours, it was reported to H/M Scoons that in Waterville Yard CPF 113 terminal personnel had discovered CTCX784021, a Loaded tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, leaking from the protective housing area. The car was isolated and Williams OHIO Valley Midstream, were notified. (CHEMTREC 2022-09-30-00208. HEPACO a CSX contractor responded and found the tank car was leaking from the protective housing area. Upon claiming the railcar and accessing the protective housing it was fond that the liquid line valve was open, and the secondary securement plug was improperly installed. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Chris Hanlon 304-312-9812 Chris.Hanlon@Williams.com. HEPACO personnel corrected the defects and secured the leak. Railcar car was released to transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-30
  • City: Brownville
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANADIAN PACIFIC RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Low speed yard derailment, car remained upright, no leak, spills or injuires. CP Response crews and contractors were dispacthed. Tank car damage assessment was completed showing AXLX3226 sustained "B" end left side body bolster damage(bent). Crews stood by during rerailing operations and reassesed the car with no changes. A receiving car was moved into place and the commodity was off loaded and continued to destination. At the time of this report, carrier and shipper are working for moving AXLX3226 to Home Shop for clean/purge and repairs

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

Report X-2022071005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-09T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-07
  • City: SOUTH PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER DISCOVERED LEAKER HALFWAY THROUGH THE TRAILER LOAD AND NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR. AS RESPONDER APPROACHED LEAKER, THEY WERE OVERHELMED BY FUMES. USING THE CHAIN OF COMMAND, MANAGER NOTIFIED HAZMAT ONE. HAZMAT ONE DISPATCHED AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER TO CLEAN UP SPILL. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER CLEANED SPILL BY PLACING INTO TWO 30 GALLON BLUE DRUMS AND LEFT ON SITE.
